title: Broadband radar absorption in high-filling factor magnetic composites
authors:
Jaume Calvo-de la Rosa, Marc Vazquez-Aige, Paula P\'erez, Laura
  Medina, Pilar Mar\'in, Jose Maria Lopez-Villegas, Javier Tejada
abstract:
The electromagnetic properties and microwave absorption capabilities are
studied under real radar conditions for layer-type composite samples consisting
of a polymeric matrix and a magnetic powder filler, either metallic or ceramic.
The effect of the filler type and the filling factor is investigated. The
obtained results show remarkable broadband microwave absorption, which make
these materials suitable for stealth technology. The experimentally measured
absorptions reach -40 dB, while model-based predictions suggest that these
systems could overpass the barrier of -50 dB. The experimental results are
supported by models, both for single and bilayer systems.
